metadata.Title: CVE-2014-1580 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.Description:
Mozilla Firefox before 33.0 does not properly initialize memory for GIFimages, which allows remote attackers to obtain sensitive information fromprocess memory via a crafted web page that triggers a sequence of renderingoperations for truncated GIF data within a CANVAS element.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2014-1580` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-globalmenu - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
firefox-testsuite - 33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: firefox package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '33.0+build2-0ubuntu0.14.04.1').
